title: Fundraiser to help save tortured pig Polly
text:
Fundraiser to help save tortured pig Polly attacked at Djanbung Gardens permaculture farm, Nimbin Claudia Jambor, The Courier-Mail January 17, 2017 3:06pm 
CARERS for a 12-year-old pig, who was allegedly hurt during a brutal attack, are calling for community support to help her along the road to recovery. 
Polly is suffering from internal and external injuries after the incident in December at the Djanbung Gardens permaculture farm near Nimbin. media_camera Polly suffered internal and external injuries in the December attack. 
The Northern Star reports that the fundraising effort was triggered when Polly’s ailing condition required a vet to be called out to the gardens on Christmas Eve. 
Mounting vet bills are proving costly for Polly’s carers, who are urging the community to dig deep to help the traumatised pig. 
The alleged attackers also killed several heritage chickens at the permaculture farm. 
“We ask if you can donate even a little for Polly to start her recovery and become the happy pig she once was before the incident,” the campaign page reads. 
With no government funding, the non-profit, self-funded organisation is struggling to help Polly while maintaining their community education and permaculture training. media_camera Polly the pig at Djanbung Permaculture Gardens in Nimbin. 
The GoFundMe page, which is raising money for her treatments, has collected almost $2000 since the assault last month. 
In the latest update, the page administrator Georgia Matherson said the embattled pig is returning to good health. 
“Grateful grunts, joyful snuffles and happy tail wags from Polly for all your love, support and generous donations. It was a week yesterday she had her last vet treatment,” the page reads. 
“We hope there’ll be no more relapses. A new year begins, may the love you give come back to you in abundance.” 
Polly is now receiving visitors again during garden open hours from 10am-4pm. 
Visit the GoFundMe page to donate and help with Polly’s recovery.
